title: Hundreds of migrants brought ashore in Italy
description:
(3 Aug 2017) About 500 migrants arrived at the Sicilian port of Catania on Thursday morning after being rescued at sea by a Spanish non-governmental organisation (NGO).
Proactiva Open Arms said they rescued a total of 494 migrants, including 119 shipwreck survivors. 
Eight bodies were recovered from the shipwreck, while survivors reported three more people had drowned, according to Proactiva Open Arms. 
Among the survivors was a two-year old girl who lost her mother and older brother.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/b48cde1f11225d80969da6eab50f8095
